node.text:
Valentina Abbona, marketing manager at her family’s @marchesibarolo estate talks about the historical property, it’s wines and challenges of the current harvest.
.
.
.
.
#wsinform #winespectator #wsstraighttalk #wine

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator on September 13, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Though set amid stunning scenery, this vineyard in Italy's Abruzzo region was pretty much unwanted when it sold at auction to the only bidders: A pair of friends looking to push the envelope. Today, it yields Montepulciano reds that earn outstanding and classic scores.⁠
⁠
In his latest dispatch, Wine Spectator's @robertcamuto_writes gets back to exploring Italy's vineyards with a look at Binomio, the label started by those two friends. Their project is one of the first new-wave stars of the 21st century in a wine region that's among the least understood in Italy. Click the linkin.bio to read more about these wines and the story behind them.⁠
⁠
📸: Courtesy of Binomio⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
. ⁠⁠
#WineSpectator #wine #Montepulciano #Italy #Italianwine #vineyard

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator on September 11, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Have you ever tried Dolcetto? The red grape is grown almost exclusively in northwest Italy's Piedmont region. It thrives in the hillside vineyards of Monferrato, where higher elevation sites help Dolcetto grapes retain enough acidity to balance their fruit-forward nature.⁠
⁠
Winemakers will sometimes strive for reds with greater concentration and structure, but most versions of Dolcetto are light- to medium-bodied sippers with expressive cherry, berry and plum notes supported by hints of herb and spice.⁠
⁠
For some impressive examples to try, Wine Spectator website members can click the linkin.bio to see new reviews of delectable Dolcettos at $22 or less.⁠
⁠
📸: Courtesy of G.D. Vajra⁠
⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
. ⁠⁠
#WineSpectator #wine #dolcetto #redwine #italianwine #piedmont

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Wine Spectator on September 10, 2021 tagging @newtonvineyard. May be an image of bottle and text that says 'NEWTON ALLEY 2018'.

node.text: Discover The Puzzle 2018, Newton’s hallmark, created for nearly 30 years. A singular mountain wine from the Spring Mountain estate that captures the purity of fruit from each block and variety that is selected for this blend. A wine with a vivacious personality and exceptional drinkability. #sponsored

May be an image of 1 person, standing, golfing and text that says 'Wine Spectator WineSpectator.com Star Golfer Turned Vintner Plays the Long Game in Wine CRISTIE KERR Great Values $25 and Under Including Two 93-Point Wines WASHINGTON'S STELLAR 2018 VINTAGE ANTHONY BOURDAIN REMEMBERED SPANISH WINEUPDAE'.

node.text:
While Cristie Kerr has achieved an extraordinary career in professional golf, her love of wine has propelled her over the past decade and promises a bright future. Our Oct. 15, 2021, issue looks at how the top-earning female golfer of all time is bringing her drive and dedication to Kerr Cellars, a close collaboration with winemaker Helen Keplinger that currently includes 7 different bottlings from Napa and Sonoma vineyards. ⁠
⁠
Also included are tasting reports on Washington and Spain, picks for great Spanish cheese and jamón to enjoy with the country's wines, a 100-wine value "showdown" between Old World and New World bottlings priced at $25 or less, and a whole lot more.⁠
⁠
See our linkin.bio for the full contents, or pick up your copy from newsstands today!⁠
⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator in Quince (restaurant) with @michaeltusk, and @quince_sf. May be an image of 2 people, people standing and indoor.

node.text:
Some people prefer to have full control over their order when dining out, but surrendering to a chef’s set menu can be highly rewarding. Our latest Restaurant Guide highlights 10 spots across the United States serving standout tasting and prix-fixe menus, with wine programs that hold @WSRestaurantAwards for their exceptional selections.⁠
⁠
At one such spot, @quince_sf, the farm-driven dishes change nightly, and the 1,200-label wine list highlights everything from Old World classics to small local producers.⁠
⁠
Have you dined at a particularly memorable tasting-menu spot? Share it with us in the comments, then head to the linkin.bio to discover more of these world-class destinations across the country.⁠
⁠
📸: Bonjwing Lee⁠
⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
. ⁠⁠
#WineSpectator #WSRestaurantAward #restaurant #dining #finedining #tastingmenu #chefstable #sanfrancisco

node.text: We caught up with star golfer–turned-vintner Cristie Kerr—the subject of Wine Spectator's Oct. 15, 2021, cover story—behind the scenes at Kerr Cellars. She chatted about how the wine industry has changed since she started working in wine, how her golf career translated to the wine world and more. Watch the full video at our linkin.bio, at WineSpectator.com/Video or on our YouTube channel at YouTube.com/WineSpectatorVideo!

node.text: We're all used to seeing @RogerFederer at the @USOpen in September, but he's tackling something more our speed this year: Hanging out in the vineyards and cellars at @MoetChandon! Head to our link in bio for the full story on his new short film series in Champagne …⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator on September 06, 2021. May be an image of fruit.

node.text:
What wine grape do you think of when you see this?⁠
⁠
This white grape can yield a range of styles from bone-dry to sweet and everything in between. It's capable of making wines of great longevity, thanks in part to its high acidity. It's believed to have originated in Germany, which remains the leading producer of these wines worldwide, but it's also a top-grown white wine grape in Washington.⁠
⁠
It's Riesling! Click the linkin.bio for our complete Know Your Grapes Series, and keep an eye out for our annual Washington tasting report coming soon in our Oct. 15 issue!⁠
⁠
📸: Andrew and Carrie Purcell⁠
⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
. ⁠⁠
#WineSpectator #wine #riesling #WSeducate #KnowYourGrapes #winegrapes #tastingnotes

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator on September 05, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Can you identify a wine just by reading its tasting note? Put your knowledge to the test with our latest mystery pick, a structured red offering explosively fruity aromas and dark fruit flavors with accents of chocolate, mocha and spice.⁠
⁠⁠
Click the linkin.bio to see the full tasting note and play this week's edition of What Am I Tasting!⁠
⁠
⁠.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
. ⁠⁠
📸: Alex Treadway/Getty Images⁠
⁠
#winespectator #wine #whatamitasting #blindtasting

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator on September 04, 2021.

node.text:
Today’s forward-thinking Spanish winemakers are focused on rediscovery. They're looking inward at the country’s winegrowing past, relying on historic grapes, lands and practices to set their wines apart. ⁠
⁠
Since our last Spain report in October 2020, more than 775 wines have been reviewed in blind tastings, showing impressive quality across the board. With approximately 40% of the total earning outstanding scores of 90 points or higher on Wine Spectator’s 100-point scale and a median price of only $25, it’s clear that the value of Spanish wine is tough to beat.⁠
⁠
Wine Spectator website members can click the linkin.bio for the full tasting report from our Oct. 15 issue that's about to hit newsstands.⁠
⁠
📸: Courtesy of @llopart1887⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
#winespectator #wine #spain #spanishwine #harvest #vineyard

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wine Spectator on September 03, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text:
Is there any more summery combo than tomatoes and corn? Just in time for Labor Day weekend, the two iconic ingredients join forces in this recipe from @davidkinch, the celebrated Bay Area chef behind @manresarestaurant.⁠
⁠
It’s a salad of sorts, but one that’s more interesting than that label implies, juxtaposing cool, raw tomatoes and warm, creamy corn. Some version of the dish has been on all of Kinch's restaurants' menus at one point or another, and it's also featured in his latest cookbook, At Home in the Kitchen.⁠
⁠
Click the linkin.bio to get the chef's recipe for this side dish as well as a garlic and ginger grilled chicken to serve alongside. Plus, see recommendations for fresh and bright white and red wines from Italy to pair with the feast.⁠
⁠
⁠📸: © Aya Brackett⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
.⁠⁠
. ⁠⁠
#winespectator #wine #recipes #wineandfood #summer #bayarea #tomato #corn #laborday
